name: Entanglement - First Person Puzzler
description:
Entanglement is a puzzle game made in only 3 hours! It takes a basic mechanic (moving boxes) and makes a fun and enjoyable puzzle game out of it. Each button will activate a doorway, but you need to figure out which doorways to trigger and in what order.

Gameplay :

There's not much to say about the gameplay! It's simple, but works extremely well. Since that game was made in 3 hours, the main goal of the game was to take a simple concept and idea and to make it more complex. For example when I created the doors, I then realised I could use them as a bridge and it kind of worked like an anti door - Doors you have to push the button to open but bridges you must have the button not pressed for it to function as a bridge.

The game is a short demo and only lasts around 10 - 20 minutes from start to finish with multiple puzzles that require thought and skill to complete.

Simple controls can create such a thoughtful game; entanglement requires you to just press the 2 buttons on your mouse to manipulate the environment around you to get the changes you need : push and pull boxes onto buttons; open doors and activate bridges; solve complex puzzles and more!

Controls :    

  • WASD - Movement   
  • Space - Jump    
  • Shift - Sprint   
  • R - Reset Boxes   
  • Left / Right - Pull / Push boxes

Can you make it to the end?

Feel free to make and share content of this game, it would be greatly appreciated; and share you opinions in the comments section!

Thanks for playing!
